newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT - Aracruz seen underperforming.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Aracruz seen underperforming.

text.p: --Oppenheimer said it started coverage of Brazilian pulp firm Aracruz Celulose SA with an underperform rating, citing the company's valuation.

--"By the majority of valuation measures, including price to earnings, firm value to EBITDA, to sales or replacement cost, Aracruz trades at an enormous premium to integrated Brazilian producers," the firm said in a statement released Tuesday.
-- It added that 1997 should be a very difficult year for Aracruz due to an expected supply and demand imbalance as pulp capacity from low-cost Asian producers comes on stream.
-- "We envision 10-15 percent downside from current valuations," the firm said.
-- It estimated Aracruz's earnings per American Depositary Share (ADS) at $0.64 for 1996, versus $1.79 for 1995, and $0.40 for 1997.
